title: **A. Hydration of a Seahorse XF<sup>e</sup>24 sensor cartridge**
body: Add 1.0 ml of XF calibrant solution to each well of a 24-well utility plate, cover the utility plate with the hydro-booster \(pink spacer), and then place the sensor cartridge in the utility plate. Finally, cover the sensor cartridge with the lid. Place the sensor cartridge in a 25°C incubator to hydrate over 12 hrs.

title: **Tip:**
body: The sensor cartridge should be hydrated at least 12 hrs before use. In our case, we allowed the sensor cartridge to hydrate overnight \(approximately 16 hrs).

body.body: Prepare 1.5 ml of Cell-Tak solution by dissolving 33.8 µg of Cell-Tak in the appropriate volume of 0.1 M sodium bicarbonate \(pH 8.0), and immediately add 1 M sodium hydroxide at half the volume of Cell-Tak stock solution \(in 5% acetic acid) used to prepare a final volume of 1.5-ml solution.

title: **Note:**
body: The concentration of Cell-Tak stock solution may vary in each lot.　We mixed 16.55 µl of Cell-Tak stock solution \(2.03 mg/ml in 5% acetic acid) with 1.475 ml of sodium bicarbonate \(0.1 M, pH 8.0) and immediately added 8.275 µl sodium hydroxide \(1 M) to adjust the pH to approximately 8.0.

body.body: Apply 50 µl of the Cell-Tak solution to each well of the XF<sup>e</sup>24 cell culture microplates and incubate them at RT for 20 min.
Aspirate the Cell-Tak solution and rinse each well twice using 200 µl of sterile water.

title: **Tip:**
body: The Cell-Tak-coated-XF<sup>e</sup>24 cell culture microplates may be stored for up 1 week at 4˚C.

title: **Tip:**
body: Use young flies at the age of 3-7 days post eclosion to obtain enough eggs, and the peak of egg-laying will come approximately 5-7 days after mating. Mating can be done either in a fly bottle or in the embryo-collecting container.

body.body: Replace the grape juice agar dish with a new one without the yeast chunk by turning the container upside down and mildly anesthetizing the flies with CO<sup>2</sup>. Culture the flies in a cooled incubator set at 25˚C for 1 hr to collect the embryos.
Remove the grape juice agar dish with the eggs from the container, and further incubate the eggs on the dish at 25˚C for 2 hrs.
Prepare Schneider's _Drosophila_ medium containing 5% FBS and 40% bleach in water just before use, and keep both at 4˚C. Chill an autoclaved Dounce tissue homogenizer with a loose pestle on ice.
Take the eggs \(embryos) on the dish out of the incubator and rinse the dish with the embryo washing buffer. Collect the embryos from the dish with a cotton swab \(
